bug.short_desc: Add support for build-system date flags for caching

long_desc.thetext:
One common pattern when hosting rich internet applications is to store the files in a specific date-dependend directory e.g. 2008-12-03_08-00-03. It might be useful to directly offer such a storing mode in the generator of qooxdoo. Currently all scripts are generated to "script" and all resources to "resource". When finally putting this stuff on a server one needs to manually manage this stuff.
This might to work well in conjunction with other enhancements of the generator: * better load script with supports for variants, languages, etc. (which can then support these date stuff, too) * generation of a HTML5 manifest file in the date-specific folder
GWT's loading idea might be helpful here to adapt.

Marked as enhancement. It might be quite a task (to offer that generically in the framework), since different strategies have to be considered (think of MD5 checksums often being superior to time stamps), and adoption to existing deployment systems via config should be possible.
